title: Tutorials
subtitle: Learn by building - from your first mesh to multiplayer games.

tutorials.title: 00 • Editor Basics
tutorials.summary: Get familiar with the visual editor, create your first mesh, and explore the interface.
steps: Launch the editor and navigate the interface
Open the Meshes panel and create a new mesh asset
Use the mesh designer to add and arrange vertices
Save your mesh and view it in the asset list
Learn about editor panels and plugin system

tutorials.title: 01 • Mesh Component Designer
tutorials.summary: Master the mesh designer workflow to create custom 2D shapes for your game.
steps: Understand the mesh designer canvas and controls
Create convex polygons with proper vertex winding
Add metadata like meshId and materialId
Test meshes by attaching them to actors
Export and integrate meshes into your game runtime

tutorials.title: 02 • Hello World
tutorials.summary: Write your first TypeScript game code with entities, components, and rendering.
steps: Set up your project structure
Initialize the engine and create a scene
Create an actor with a sprite component
Implement the game loop with update logic
Render to the screen and handle input

tutorials.title: 03 • Input & Physics
tutorials.summary: Capture keyboard input, apply physics forces, and handle collisions.
steps: Set up the input manager for WASD controls
Create a player entity with physics component
Apply movement forces based on input
Add collision boundaries and detect impacts
Implement collision response logic

tutorials.title: 04 • Editor Plugins
tutorials.summary: Extend the editor by creating custom panels, tools, and UI components.
steps: Learn the EditorUIPlugin interface and activation
Create a custom panel with React components
Use IoC dependency injection to access the editor
Register context menu items for scene interactions
Build reusable editor tools for your workflow

tutorials.title: 05 • Actor Synchronization
tutorials.summary: Understand the input-based replication protocol for multiplayer games.
steps: Learn about client-owned vs server-owned actors
Implement input capture on the client
Set up the ServerReplicationManager to validate inputs
Configure client prediction and reconciliation
Test synchronization with multiple clients

tutorials.title: 06 • Multiplayer Game
tutorials.summary: Build a complete multiplayer game with authoritative server and client prediction.
steps: Configure WebSocket server with the engine
Implement client connection and authentication
Send input batches from client to server
Broadcast actor state updates at 60Hz
Test with artificial lag and multiple players

tutorials.title: 07 • Custom Rendering
tutorials.summary: Choose and configure rendering backends - PixiJS, Canvas2D, or Three.js.
steps: Understand the renderer adapter pattern
Set up PixiJS for high-performance WebGL rendering
Implement custom shaders and effects
Switch between rendering backends
Optimize render performance with culling
